== Validation Experiments with 37h1.beta1, 37h1.beta2, re-release 37h1 ==

=== Introduction ===

A coordinated validation of harmonie-37h1 has been organised in HIRLAM-B with a view to enable release of the second official and quality assured HARMONIE forecast system, 37h1. The first phase of validation is based on code version harmonie-37h1.beta.1. Following the successful validation of 36h1.3, the emphasis in the first phase of the CY37 validation is on relative behavior of CY37, in comparison to CY36 (and operational HIRLAM), over different operational domains at the HIRLAM member services, for winter and summer seasons. Various scripts problem and stability issues have been encountered during the first phase. More bugfixes were implemented from MF-versions, and various tuning and corrections have been made since, which lead to tagging of 37h1.beta2 and 37h1. These include modification of soil moisture conversion schemefrom external model, return from edkf to edmfm in AROME setting, tuning of strength of surfex drag in SSO and CANOPY_DRAG, switch-on of LSMIXBC, as well as numerous scripts and utility update.  Further validation studies were configured associated with these correction and tuning. In addition, experiemnts were made about LBC frequency and impact of surface assimilation vs surface downscaling. In the final phase prior to tagging of 37h1, two monthly-long runs are carried through to confirm sanity of all the bug corrections and modifications.
=== Baseline experiments and configuration options ===
The baseline experiments are defined for several model configurations using AROME and ALARO physics, cycled with surface with or without 3D-VAR, and coupled to ECMWF forecasts as lateral boundaries,respectively
 * AROME: DENMARK, FINLAND, IRELAND25, IBERIA_2.5, ICELAND, LITHUANIAL and NUUK domains at 2.5 /2 km grid spacing and 65/HIRLAM_60 vertical levels, 24-48 h forecast
 * ALARO: SCANDINAVIA_5.5 domain with 5.5 km spacing and 60 levels, 3DVAR, surfex forecast and analysis, 36 h forecast 
In addition, some validation studies also involve alternative configurations to examine sensitivities on
 * assimilation scheme (downscaling; surface analysis only, for ICELAND domain)
 * physics & surface schemes (edkf vs edmfm in AROME, ALARO with surfex vs isba scheme)
 * LSMIXBC (with 3DVAR runs of AROME DENMARK, ALARO SCANDINAVIA_5.5)
 * modification of soil moisture conversion from ECMWF to HARMONIE-surfex (SCANDINAVIA, FINLAND and ICELAND domains)
 * CANOPY_DRAG and strength of SSO in surfex  (DENMARK and NUUK domains)
 * vertical resolutions (using HIRLAM_60 or 65, IRELAND25 domain)
AROME validation
  * The initial phase consists of following experiments
    * DENMARK, 37h1beta1 3dvar+surface da, episode 2010-01 and 2010-08, edkh, edmfm, strfuns with 36h14 3dvar, (Wim, Shiyu, Bjarne, Xiaohua)
    * FINLAND, 37h1beta1 3dvar+surface da, episode 2010-01 and 2011-08, (Sami N.) 
    * NUUK (Greenland) surface da, episode 2011-07 and 2011-12 (Bjarne, Xiaohua)
    * ICELAND, 36h1.4bf1(surface da), 37h1.beta1 (surface da/none), episode 2011-07 and episode 2011-12 (Sigurdue J., Xiaohua)
    * IBERIA_2.5, 3dvar+surface da, 36h1.4bf1/37h1.beta1, episode 2009-12 + 201110, (Javier and Estrella); 37h1.beta2 (Gema and Daniel)
    * IRELAND25, 3dvar+surface da, 36h1.4bf1/37h1.beta1, 2011111600-2011123118 (BDINT=3/BDINT=1, Eoin)
    * LITHUANIAL, 36h1.4bf1(surface da), 37h1.beta1 (surface da), episode 2010-01 and 2010-08, (Martynas)
  * Further tests have been configured on test of 
      * edmfm vs edkf
      * lsmixbc
      * hourly or 3 hourly boundary, blending or 3dvar, L60 or L65
      * modified ECMWF soil moisture conversion scheme by Sander and Toon
      * kfrac0 (for domains with substantial mountain coverage), kcdrag
ALARO validation
    * ala_37h1b1_1 setup, scandinavia_5.5+L65, 3dvar+surface da, ( + lmixbc), 2009122000-2010013118 (Ulf)
      * ECSWI, same as above, but with modified swi conversion (Toon M.)
    * ala_37h1b1_1_lmbc (Mariken): ala_37h1b1_1 + LSMIXBC=yes, 2009122000 - 2010013118               
    * ala_37h1b1_1 (Lisa): Same as Ulf but for  2010072000-2010083118
    * ala_37h1b1_1_lmbc (Ole): Same as Lisa but with LMIXBC=yes

=== List of topics examined ===
 * General Meteorological Qualities: how does the models compare to comparables with ECMWF/HIRLAM/36h1/ for extreme as well as average weather conditions: main advantages and deficiencies
  * verification scores inter-comparisons 
  * extreme weather episode and case study 
  * local characteristics (domain/mountain/coastal/forest/lake...)
   * Summer and winter time precipitation
   * Surface Temperature
   * Surface wind/gust
   * Cloud/fog/visibility
   * analysis of snow, ice
 * Tuning potentials, sensitivity experiments and results
   * edmfm vs edkf
   * swi conversion
   * zcdrag in canopy_drag
   * zfrac0 in sso
   * analysis/blending/lsmixbc, surface downscaling/assimilation
   * vertical resolution
   * time steps, stability
 * Technical quality
   * Computational efficiency for various configurations (domain, analysis and forecast options, time steps etc.)
   * handling of observations
   * Run-time stability
